name: occurrence
title: Occurrence
description: A state of a dwc:Organism in a dwc:Event.
examples: `a wolf pack on the shore of Kluane Lake in 1988`; `a virus in a plant leaf in the New York Botanical Garden at 15:29 on 2014-10-23`; `a fungus in Central Park in the summer of 1929`
rdfs:comment: An existence of a dwc:Organism at a particular place at a particular time.

fields.name: occurrenceID
fields.title: Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: isPartOfOccurrenceID
fields.title: Is Part Of Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence of which this dwc:Occurrence is a part.
fields.comments: Used to define a subset of a dwc:Occurrence for which there may be distinct characteristics.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: surveyTargetID
fields.title: Survey Target ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:SurveyTarget.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: recordedBy
fields.title: Recorded By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for recording a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `José E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson` (where the value in dwc:collectorNumber `OPP 7101` corresponds to the collector number for the specimen in the field catalog of Oliver P. Pearson)
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (dwc:recordNumber), should be listed first.

fields.name: recordedByID
fields.title: Recorded By ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for recording a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: organismQuantity
fields.title: Organism Quantity
fields.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
fields.comments: A dwc:organismQuantity must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantityType.
fields.examples: `27` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType); `12.5` (organismQuantity) with `% biomass` (organismQuantityType); `r` (organismQuantity) with `Braun-Blanquet Scale` (organismQuantityType); `many` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType)
fields.rdfs:comment: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.

fields.name: organismQuantityType
fields.title: Organism Quantity Type
fields.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
fields.comments: A dwc:organismQuantityType must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantity. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `27` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType); `12.5` (organismQuantity) with `% biomass` (organismQuantityType); `r` (organismQuantity) with `Braun-Blanquet Scale` (organismQuantityType); `many` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType)
fields.rdfs:comment: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.

fields.name: sex
fields.title: Sex
fields.description: A sex of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: lifeStage
fields.title: Life Stage
fields.description: An age class or life stage of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The age class or life stage of the dwc:Organism(s) at the time the dwc:Occurrence was recorded.

fields.name: reproductiveCondition
fields.title: Reproductive Condition
fields.description: A reproductive condition of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: caste
fields.title: Caste
fields.description: A social caste of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary that aligns best with a dwc:Taxon. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: Categorisation of individuals for eusocial species (including some mammals and arthropods).

fields.name: behavior
fields.title: Behavior
fields.description: A behavior shown by a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The behavior shown by the subject at the time the dwc:Occurrence was recorded.

fields.name: vitality
fields.title: Vitality
fields.description: An indication of whether a dwc:Organism was alive or dead at the time of collection or observation.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: An indication of whether a dwc:Organism was alive or dead at the time of collection or observation.

fields.name: establishmentMeans
fields.title: Establishment Means
fields.description: Statement about whether a dwc:Organism has been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/em/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: Statement about whether a dwc:Organism has been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.

fields.name: degreeOfEstablishment
fields.title: Degree Of Establishment
fields.description: The degree to which a dwc:Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/doe/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The degree to which a dwc:Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.

fields.name: pathway
fields.title: Pathway
fields.description: The process by which a dwc:Organism came to be in a given place at a given time.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/pw/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The process by which a dwc:Organism came to be in a given place at a given time.

fields.name: substrate
fields.title: Substrate
fields.description: A biotic or abiotic material to which an dwc:Organism is attached when a dwc:Event occurs.
fields.comments: This may or may not imply that the organism influenced/took resources from the substrate (such as during parasitization or decomposition). Declaration of a host-parasite relationship is better expressed as an organism interaction.

fields.name: occurrenceStatus
fields.title: Occurrence Status
fields.description: A statement about the detection or non-detection of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: For dwc:Occurrences, the default vocabulary is recommended to consist of 'detected' and 'notDetected', but can be extended by implementers with good justification. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A statement about the presence or absence of a dwc:Taxon at a dcterms:Location.

fields.name: occurrenceReferences
fields.title: Occurrence References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibliographicResources associated with a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: informationWithheld
fields.title: Information Withheld
fields.description: Additional information that exists about a resource, but that is not shared publicly.
fields.examples: `location information not given for endangered species`; `collector identities withheld | ask about tissue samples`
fields.rdfs:comment: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.title: Data Generalizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.examples: `Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

fields.name: occurrenceRemarks
fields.title: Occurrence Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the dwc:Occurrence.
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: organismID
fields.title: Organism ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Organism.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: organismScope
fields.title: Organism Scope
fields.description: A description of the type of a dwc:Organism instance.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Can be used to indicate whether a dwc:Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation.
fields.rdfs:comment: A description of the kind of dwc:Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether the dwc:Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation.

fields.name: organismName
fields.title: Organism Name
fields.description: A name or label assigned to a dwc:Organism.
fields.rdfs:comment: A textual name or label assigned to a dwc:Organism instance.

fields.name: causeOfDeath
fields.title: Cause Of Death
fields.description: An indication of the known or suspected cause of death of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: The cause may be due to natural causes (e.g., disease, predation), human-related activities (e.g., roadkill, pollution), or other environmental factors (e.g., extreme weather events).
fields.rdfs:comment: An indication of the known or suspected cause of death of a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: organismRemarks
fields.title: Organism Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: `One of a litter of six`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:Organism instance.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.title: Verbatim Identification
fields.description: A string representing a taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.
fields.examples: `Peromyscus sp.`; `Ministrymon sp. nov. 1`; `Anser anser × Branta canadensis`; `Pachyporidae?`, `Potentilla × pantotricha Soják`; `Aconitum pilipes × A. variegatum; `Lepomis auritus x cyanellus`
fields.rdfs:comment: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.title: Identified By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the Event. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.title: Identified By ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)
fields.rdfs:comment: A person, group, or organization who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.title: Date Identified
fields.description: A date on which the subject was determined as representing a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at or after 2:07pm and before 2:08pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 at or after 8:40am and before 8:41 UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (29 August 2018 at or after 3:19pm and before 3:20pm local time); `1809-02-12` (within the day 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (in the month of June 1906); `1971` (in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time within the interval beginning 1 March 2007 at 1pm UTC and before 11 May 2008 at 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time within the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and before the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between the beginning of 13 November 2007 and before 15 November 2007)
fields.rdfs:comment: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the dwc:Taxon.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.title: Identification References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibliographicResources used in a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the Survey. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the dwc:Identification.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.title: Identification Verification Status
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which a taxonomic determination has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.
fields.rdfs:comment: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.title: Identification Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the uñas.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:Identification.

fields.name: taxonID
fields.title: Taxon ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: In DwC-DP, the taxonID is always an external link to a taxon record. As such, if present, it should be a resolvable globally unique identifier. See the Identifiers section of https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp/blob/master/README.md.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of dwc:Taxon information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: scientificNameID
fields.title: Scientific Name ID
fields.description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.
fields.comments: In DwC-DP, the taxonID is always an external link to a taxon record. As such, if present, it should be a resolvable globally unique identifier. See the Identifiers section of https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp/blob/master/README.md.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description: A scientific name string, not including authorship, date or identification qualifiers.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet); `×Agropogon littoralis`; `Mentha ×smithiana`; `Agrostis stolonifera L. × Polypogon monspeliensis`
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the dwc:identificationQualifier term.

fields.name: scientificNameAuthorship
fields.title: Scientific Name Authorship
fields.description: The authorship information for a dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.
fields.rdfs:comment: The authorship information for the dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.

fields.name: vernacularName
fields.title: Vernacular Name
fields.description: A common or vernacular name.
fields.rdfs:comment: A common or vernacular name.

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.title: Taxon Rank
fields.description: A taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. The taxon ranks of algae, fungi and plants are defined in the International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants (Schenzhen Code Articles H3.2, H4.4 and H.3.1).
fields.rdfs:comment: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: externalClassificationSource
fields.title: External Classification Source
fields.description: A reference to a source outside the dataset where the identifying name, code, or taxon concept can be found.
fields.comments: The external source applies to whichever of dwc:taxonID, dwc:scientificNameID, minext:geoClassificationCode, minext:geoName, dwc:scientificName, or dwc:vernacularName is populated.
fields.examples: `http://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/taxon/`; `https://avibase.bsc-eoc.org/`; `Dana, J. D., Dana, E. S., & Gaines, R. V. (1997). Dana's new mineralogy: The system of mineralogy of James Dwight Dana and Edward Salisbury Dana.`; `Strunz H, Nickel EH (2001) Strunz Mineralogical Tables, 9th Edition. Berlin and Stuttgart 870 pp.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: feedbackURL
fields.title: Feedback URL
fields.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to optionally include query strings that act to pre-populate web page form elements and communicate the context.
fields.rdfs:comment: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
